p: The impacts of hurricane‐related saltwater intrusion have been well documented for wetland vegetation and many vertebrates found in coastal habitats (e.g., Guntenspergen et al., 1995; Gunzburger, Hughes, Barichivich, & Staiger, 2010; Roman et al., 1994; Schriever, Ramspott, Crother, & Fontenot, 2009; Steyer et al., 2010), yet proactive approaches to reduce threats from hurricanes before they occur are often lacking. This deficiency provides an opportunity to revisit existing strategies for managing vulnerable species in hurricane‐prone areas and to develop or update action plans where needed (sensu Povilitis & Suckling, 2010).
